review_blob:
This is my third Kirsch Gose..

from the bottle lemon, cherry, salt, medium carb, slight soy, very slight balsamic, slightly creamy..salt and tart lemon cherry lingers , raspberry
the salt cuts the super tang I like but overall the third beer has me hooked

1rst one was warm in the bottle- didnt like that much
2nd was very cold in a chalice...not overly impressed
3rd in the bottle and not chilled too much- I like it very much

a bit pricey at 4 for $10 but I would probably buy again

strong beer...plums, raisins dominate...sour cherry as it warms

thick , ropey

recommend as a good flanders old brun ( more intense than what Im used to ) 

enjoyable 90%

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob:
very good cider..sour as the name granny smith would make you expect
a bit low on carbonation- I would prefer more carbonation
a good tangy sour apple cider..I will keep buying this one..sessionable

I like sour beers so this is something to throw into a shopping trip as a changeup

I am searching for a good sour lacto cider that can match a flanders

this is ok

bottle from wegmans-niagara falls
very good ..heavy balsamic notes..thick plum and caramels
I was overwhelmed with the balsamic..the wife loved it and siad it was very cherry and rated among the best weve/shes had

me- again heavy plum, thick balsamic, oak..great stuff but not as sour as I like

95%

drank straight from the bottle classic flanders vinous..sour cherry and mellow tang
tang stays on the tongue-soft. slight fruit mellow semi sweet vinegar lingering

sour plums, orangey grapes...some soy and sweet balsamic savoury almost datelike

I was going to say the bottled grand cru was better but this is a bit more savory..I would drink this as a sessionable if I could

beautiful stuff (only 2 left :()

very good beer...straight out of the bottle properly chilled
creamy, clean lemony soapy mouthfeel-tiny bit of oily barely perceptable at first...mellows to unripe red grapefruit tang. Sharp citrus rinds come through later heavy bittersharp grapefruit rind tho just shortlived with a slight caramel creamyness that mellows out very very nicely

worldclass...and I say that and hops are really not my thing but I would drink this again anyday...maybe with some smoked franks red hot peanuts ( haha- maybe we need to make those )

palate cleans

smell of lacto...like a half n half cream that has turned. very light tasting the cherry is subtle , more on the citrusy hoppy side. Finishes very cleanly leaving a bit of cream, milk aftertaste
its almost like the pinot and cherry and hops are competing and seem to wash each other out to a clean finish.
Low carbonation...its an ok beer but a bit pricey and I was hoping for a more sour note. For a 6.5% it is quite light. The more I taste the more I like it...the citrus backs off as it warms

Right out of the bottle
yes maple syrup and bananas with a very light lime/lemon hop slight aftertaste. A bit too sweet for me. Might taste good on pancakes if you make a reduction.
Creamy and a smooth sweet caramel. Maybe plum/dried prune style honey on the palate. Low carbonation
Alcohol is well hidden for 8.3%. Very drinkable but in a maple marshmallow with a hint of lemon way. Cannot taste any wood or cherry but I finished a chimay a little while ago.
Still a well crafted beer but more of an aperitif type and having a one off is enough. Iwas thinking colder might be better but I suspect it would even intensify the honey sweet on the mouth.
Quality beer and my ratings are low mostly because I likes my sours. I was hoping for more of the cherry the box mentions

wonderful. It is perfect to me. Not too sour, cherries, slightly creamy. Leaves a slight tart on the palate
I love this one and my previous favorite was the Panil sour. This one is mellower and finishes very clean. I would drink 20 of these if I could. Ill buy this little beer every chance I can get. Cherry and a smooth light lemon hop that stays behind the cherry. Slightly sweet even.
So good you want to down it but so good you have to stop and savour and roll it on your tongue for a while.

straight from the bottle like a man...
under-rated but the best canadian beer because its one of the very very few that you can have 12 or more and your body doesnt start rejecting as toxic
winey, carby, a bit sour...its my cheap reliable "go to" out of all the canadian brands..the rest will tox you out and make you wanna throw up from malt or bad grade hops
drinkability (numbers and getting bombed by)  should be a rating because this one deserves a 60%  ( be bombed out and still not get grossed out ) 
I do joke because I am searching out and having the "best" 99-100 rated beers and becoming a half assed connoisseur. I think my mind will change when I get my taste buds on a cantillon if I can afford a dozen

straight from the bottle like a man as always...bit sour like I am told a farmhouse saison should be. 
carby, mellow hops, tangy lemon, vanilla slight, citrus rind. Creamy on the tongue at first and goes mild acid quickly after. Carbs and burps follow that are not immediately perceptable (carbonation is a bit high)
creamy if you let it linger in the mouth at first but gets much more sour if you hold it
creamy orange and lemon rinds...top end beer but there are others at the price
nothing wrong with this one but I am searching for a different  taste..85%

bar volo....recommended by the bar tender
slightly sour, raspberry I think- not cherry, poured light cloudy rose, some lemon hops
very nice- I only had one but a dozen would have been better. 
Would buy this again any time- even at bar price

this is the special brown...the bottle appears different and the label is Brasserie des rocs gand cru
straight from the bottle like I will always...very very smooth for 9%. Very small bottle.Sweet candy toasted caramel .Hoppy almost marshmallow  finish and aftertaste. Milky toffee almost and a slight citrus hop tang. Medium carbonation creamy mouth feel with a wet mild hop ending. Smooth..you know you have had a real stong ale at the end despite the small bottle

straight from the bottle citrus but probably hops..aroma is light hops. Yes somewhat sharp hops but mellows quickly..high alcohol but you would never know. Finishes slightly creamy slight lemon hops remains.
Carbonation seems low but  makes itself evident after swallowing (haha)
There is a caramel or toffee..cane sugar style mild that knocks down the hoppiness good beer.Smooth

this is my first post...panil sour is a great way to start and it might be all downhill from here (haha)...straight from the bottle will be all my posts

sour yes detect lemon...aged yeasty  vinegar aroma clean finish sour finish that clears relatively quickly to almost a sour creamy left on the tongue for after taste
orange maybe...definitely citrus zest vanilla hintswith cherry hints
warming up more citrus coming out...better at chilled..very little carbonation
creamy mouth feel almost oily mouthfeel pours opaque amber..oak or hickory kind of spruce in there somewhere no bitterness..great aftertaste was good with a cigarette a good cigar would be better..top notch-I feel lucky  top of the heap

2nd beer colder I attack it like a true beer  bottlefed drinker-no savour..chugs low carb..very mild, slightly sour, good aftertaste somewhat sour, citrus peels still, lemon orange..not bitter, sour ends quick maybe the sweet is the cherry-something in there is adding sweetness to the finish but imperceptable -rasberry maybe yah!..high quality quite noticable cleanliness.high end..I would put this up against better wines anytime..significantly better cold..and swishing it around your mouth makes it warm up and taste off
